intro: Meniscium opacum, commonly known as the opacous meniscium, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional herbal medicine. Meniscium opacum is also noted for its aromatic properties and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
